posts.name: Pete Walters
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.50 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.49 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.50.0.658-beta

42 new commits since 7.49.0.651-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.50 [1]

  • Only load threadUniqueIds, not thread models, for Chat List load [2]

  • Fix database reentry crash [3]

  • Preserve pinned chat order [4]

  • Update RTL note-to-self icon [5]

  • Remove method on CLVC that forwards to loadCoordinator [6]

  • remove last firstly for Guarantee [7]

  • create an UncooperativeTimeout for async world as a migration assist from promises [8]

  • switch to cooperative timeout for observing notification [9]

  • use the callback based PKPushRegistryDelegate method instead of synchronously blocking [10] (reverted by [11])

  • Revert "use the callback based PKPushRegistryDelegate method instead of synchronously blocking" […] [11] (reverts [10])

  • Avoid chat list update for non-latest-interaction-in-thread touches [12]

  • Update even non-visible cells in-place, rather than calling reloadRows [13]

  • Re-add removed iOS 13(+?) workaround [14]

  • Use Date, not MonotonicDate, to seed sequential UUIDv7s [15]

  • Turn on libsignal-based chat connections for beta users […] [16]

  • Fix UUID v7 version/variant bits [17]

  • Stop using MonotonicDate.distantPast [18]

  • Properly fall back to setting the master key during provisioning [19]

  • Remove OWSChatConnectionWithLibSignalShadowing [20]

  • convert debug logs upload from promises to swift concurrency [21]

  • convert DebugLogs from class to enum and remove objc compat [22]

  • Rename content field to match the server’s name [23]

  • simplify promise code to swift concurrency [24]

  • Batch outgoing receipts when sending them [25]

  • Always suppress 409 errors from donation subscription-redemption jobs [26]

  • Update all presentThread APIs to take a threadUniqueId [27]

  • Mark Note to Self messages from incoming sync transcripts as read [28]

  • Exclude local ACI from some “leave group” checks [29]

  • Use GSEs as a fallback when fetching profiles [30]

  • convert giphyapi off of promises [31]

  • Update undownloadable image icon and toast [32]

  • Enable Link'n'Sync iPad import for production [33]

  • Fix “Next” button when looking up phone numbers [34]

  • Remove unused String.truncated method [35]

  • Prefer infallible String → Data construct [36]

  • Clamp UInt64 unit progress in recreate indexes step [37]

  • Update release notes [38]

  • Update translations [39]

  • Remove unnecessary CVComponent hooks [40]

  • Remove more CV indirection [41]

  • Download media as it becomes visible in a chat [42]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.49.0.651-beta…7.50.0.658-beta

Localization changes for the release are the same, as this is the first build of the release.

What are the steps for synchronizing chat history on linked devices? I have my iPhone (primary) and iPad (linked device) both running Signal beta 7.50 (658) with TestFlight and I am not seeing any settings options for synchronizing nor am I given the option to synchronize when I unlink and relink the iPad. And I definitely have messages in my chats that were posted within the last 45 days and before linking the iPad. Need some guidance. Thanks.

Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.46 release

testing this requires deleting existing Signal data from your iPad (either via Settings → Account → Delete All Data or by reinstalling) and re-linking. Re-linking will restore your message history and last 30 days of media

To get the option to sync messages,you need to delete the data from Signal on your iPad, not just unlink it and relink it. The option only appears when your secondary device doesn’t have any existing data in its Signal app. Note that you will lose any media on your iPad which is older than 30 days if you do this.

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.46 release

posts.cooked:
Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.51 release.
